meanings.definition: The quality or character of being scholarly or academic.
meanings.sent1: Her donnishness was evident in the way she always had a book in hand.
meanings.sent2: The professor's donnishness shone through in his precise explanations.
meanings.sent3: His donnishness reached new heights when he started using Latin phrases in everyday conversations.
meanings.sent4: The donnishness of the library made it feel like a sanctuary of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The donnishness of her glasses and tweed jacket gave her an air of intelligence.

meanings.definition: The behavior or mannerisms typical of a university professor.
meanings.sent1: The donnishness of his gestures reminded me of my old college professor.
meanings.sent2: She adopted a certain donnishness when discussing complex theories.
meanings.sent3: The donnishness of his outfit was complete with elbow patches on his blazer.
meanings.sent4: His donnishness was so convincing that some mistook him for a real professor.
meanings.sent5: The donnishness of his speech pattern made it clear he was well-versed in academia.
